Function to create a bar chart race
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{excel}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} excel file containing the data

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{title}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} title on top of the animation

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{sub\_title}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} sub\sphinxhyphen{}title to provide extra context, displayed just under the main title

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{duration}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{integer}}) \textendash{} length of the animation

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{fps}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{integer}}) \textendash{} number of frames per second

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{record}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} should the animation be saved as an mp4? Defaults to False. If set to True, the render speed on screen is reduced, however, the playback speed of the video is correct.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{output\_video}} \textendash{} name of the saved video.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{unit}} \textendash{} unit to be displayed in the graph

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{time\_indicator}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{\textquotesingle{}day\textquotesingle{}}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{\textquotesingle{}month\textquotesingle{}}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, or }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{\textquotesingle{}year\textquotesingle{}}}) \textendash{} should the time format show year, month or day

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{background\_color}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{tuple}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ (}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{R}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{G}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{B}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{)}}) \textendash{} color of the background. \item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{colors}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{dict}}) \textendash{} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
dictionary that holds color information for each of the data categories. The key of the dict should
corespond to the name of the data category (column). The value of the dict should be the RGB values of the color:
\begin{quote}
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{\{}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{“United States”: {[}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
23,
60,
225

\end{description}

\sphinxAtStartPar
{]}

\end{description}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\}, default is \{\}
\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
{]}

\end{description}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\}, default is \{\}
\end{quote}


\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Parem events}
\sphinxAtStartPar
dictionary to add additional context to the line chart. For example to indicate events in time. Example:
events = \{
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
“\{EVENT NAME\}”: {[}“START DATE DD/MM/YYYY”, “END DATE DD/MM/YYYY”{]},
“Event 1”: {[}“28/01/2017”, “28/01/2018”{]},
“Event 2”: {[}“28/01/2019”, “28/01/2020”{]},
“Last event”: {[}“28/05/2020”, “28/01/2021”{]}
\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{sub\_title}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} sub\sphinxhyphen{}title to provide extra context, displayed just under the main title

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{duration}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{integer}}) \textendash{} length of the animation

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{fps}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{integer}}) \textendash{} number of frames per second

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{record}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} should the animation be saved as an mp4? Defaults to False. If set to True, the render speed on screen is reduced, however, the playback speed of the video is correct.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{output\_video}} \textendash{} name of the saved video.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{unit}} \textendash{} unit to be displayed in the graph

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{time\_indicator}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{\textquotesingle{}day\textquotesingle{}}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{\textquotesingle{}month\textquotesingle{}}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, or }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{\textquotesingle{}year\textquotesingle{}}}) \textendash{} should the time format show year, month or day

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{font\_color}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{tuple}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ (}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{R}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{G}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{B}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{)}}) \textendash{} color of the texts rendered to the screen. In RGB colors.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{background\_color}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{tuple}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ (}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{R}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{G}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{B}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{)}}) \textendash{} color of the background. In RGB colors.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{colors}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{dict}}) \textendash{} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
dictionary that holds color information for each of the data categories. The key of the dict should
corespond to the name of the data category (column). The value of the dict should be the RGB values of the color:
\begin{quote}
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{\{}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{“United States”: {[}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
23,
60,
225

\end{description}

\sphinxAtStartPar
{]}

\end{description}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\}, default is \{\}
\end{quote}


\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Parem events}
\sphinxAtStartPar
dictionary to add additional context to the line chart. For example to indicate events in time. Example:
events = \{
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
“\{EVENT NAME\}”: {[}“START DATE DD/MM/YYYY”, “END DATE DD/MM/YYYY”{]},
“Event 1”: {[}“28/01/2017”, “28/01/2018”{]},
“Event 2”: {[}“28/01/2019”, “28/01/2020”{]},
“Last event”: {[}“28/05/2020”, “28/01/2021”{]}
\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

Class to add a static text to the visualization
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{text}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} text to be displayed, for example a title

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{anchor}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} Anchors are used to define where text is positioned relative to a reference point. Possible values correspond wind directions:
NW
N
NE
W
CENTER
E
SW
S
SE

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{canvas}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{tkinter.Canvas}}) \textendash{} tkinter canvas to draw the graph to

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{width}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} width of the plot in pixels, default depends on screen resolution

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{height}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} height of the text, closely resembles font size

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{x\_pos}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} the x location of the top left pixel in this plot, default depends on screen resolution

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{y\_pos}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} the y location of the top left pixel in this plot, default depends on screen resolution

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{font\_color}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{tuple}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ of }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{length 3 with integers}}) \textendash{} font color, default is (0,0,0)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{angle}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} rotation of the text by number of degrees

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}
